summary: This document contains a forwarded email chain discussing a meeting regarding Jeffrey Epstein and a sex trafficking case involving him. The correspondence mentions a meeting scheduled to discuss the complexities of the case and the involvement of multiple lawyers representing a victim who claims to have been prostituted by Epstein at the age of 16.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is discussed as the central figure in a sex trafficking case, with allegations of having numerous victims.

persons.name: Pete Skinner
persons.context: Pete Skinner is mentioned as one of the lawyers who pitched a sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Pete Skinner is representing a victim in a case against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Meeting Discussion on Epstein Case
events.description: A meeting is discussed to talk about the complexities of the sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The document discusses a sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein involving a victim who claims to have been prostituted by him at age 16.
Pete Skinner and two other lawyers are involved in pitching the case.
Epstein is noted to have had dozens of victims, and the timeline of his criminal conduct is unclear.
There are several related civil cases, and Epstein previously entered into a non-prosecution agreement in 2007.
